pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:5.1: 14. The training rule on dismissing a companion
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:6.2: At that time the nun Thullanandā stood and talked alone with men on streets, in cul-de-sacs, and at crossroads, and she whispered in their ears and dismissed her companion nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:7.1: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:7.2: “How can Venerable Thullanandā stand and talk alone with men on streets, in cul-de-sacs, and at crossroads, and whisper in their ears and dismiss her companion nun?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:7.3: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:7.6: “… How can the nun Thullanandā stand and talk alone with men on streets, in cul-de-sacs, and at crossroads, and whisper in their ears and dismiss her companion nun?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:7.7: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:7.8: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:8.1: ‘If a nun stands or talks alone with a man on a street or in a cul-de-sac or at a crossroads, or she whispers in his ear or dismisses her companion nun, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:10.2: a carriage road is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:10.4: one departs the same way one entered.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:10.6: a square is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:11.2: a human male, not a male spirit, not a male ghost, not a male animal. He understands and is capable of standing together and talking.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:12.4: just the man and the nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:13.2: if she stands within arm’s reach of the man, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:14.2: if she stands talking within arm’s reach of the man, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:15.2: if she speaks into the ear of a man, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:16.2: if, wanting to misbehave, she dismisses her companion nun, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:16.3: If the companion nun is in the process of going beyond eyesight or earshot, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:16.4: When the companion nun has gone beyond, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:17.1: If she stands or talks outside of arm’s reach, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:17.2: If she stands or talks with a spirit, a ghost, a eunuch, or an animal in human form, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:18.8: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:19.1: The fourth training rule is finished.
